content.text:
In a Residence R-1 District the following regulations
shall apply:

Uses. No building shall be erected, altered, remodeled,
used or maintained and no lot or premises shall be used except for
one or more of the following purposes:

A detached, single-family dwelling, with a two-, three-
or four-car private noncommercial garage, used exclusively for residential
purposes.

A dwelling for not more than one family in which there
may be practiced or carried on, as an accessory use, by one person
in the family who occupies such dwelling, the professional occupations
of medicine, dentistry, law, architecture or such other professional
occupation that is permitted on the premises by the Board of Appeals
when application is made by the person who proposes to practice or
carry on such professional occupation, provided that the person practicing
or carrying on such professional occupation:

Confines the practice or carrying on of such
professional occupation to no more than 25% of the gross floor area
of the dwelling, but not to exceed 800 square feet.[Amended 11-6-2000 by L.L. No. 3-2000]

Restricts the practice of carrying on such professional
occupation to that portion of the dwelling above the level of the
surrounding ground.

Employs only in that portion of the dwelling
where the professional occupation is practiced or carried on no more
than three assistants, associates or employees at any one time.

Restricts all display or advertising to one
professional nameplate no greater in area than 72 square inches, upon
which shall be inscribed only the name of the person practicing or
carrying on such professional occupation and the letters or abbreviations
indicating the professional occupation practiced or carried on.

Provides at least one off-street on-site parking
space for the person practicing or carrying on the professional occupation
and at least two off-street, on-site parking places for each assistant,
associate or employee employed in connection with such professional
occupation, and each such person, assistant, associate or employee
shall park his or her vehicle only on such off-street on-site parking
place.[Amended 11-6-2000 by L.L. No. 3-2000]
(Reserved)[1]

content.footnote:
[1]
Editor's Note: Former Subsection A(3), regarding real estate
signage, was repealed 9-8-2009 by L.L. No. 17-2009.

content.text:
Accessory uses customarily incident to the above uses
and located on the same lot with them, including gardening, nurseries
and greenhouses, provided that such use is not for the sale of the
products and provided that there is no display of the products and
no advertising. Except as above provided, accessory uses shall not
include business uses or any billboards or advertising signs. No use
which is objectionable or detrimental to the well-being or harmonious
character of the neighborhood shall be permitted.

A fence or other structure deemed by the Board
of Appeals to be designed primarily to cause annoyance or damage to
an adjoining owner shall in no case be permitted as an accessory use.
One tennis court or elevated court may be constructed as an accessory use to a one-family dwelling located on the same lot and in conformance with Chapter 212, Tennis and Other Courts.

No building shall be constructed on a lot with an
area of less than one acre.

The maximum lot coverage shall not exceed 15% of the
lot area. The maximum floor area ratio shall be 0.165. The sky exposure
plane shall be 1.0.[2][Amended 11-6-2000 by L.L. No. 3-2000; 6-7-2004 by L.L. No.
3-2004]

content.footnote:
[2]
Editor's Note: See the Sky Exposure Plane Diagrams included at the end of this chapter.

content.text:
There shall be a front yard, the depth of which shall
be at least 85% of the average setback of two adjoining properties
to each side of the property line plus five houses across the street
and in no case less than 60 feet.[Amended 11-6-2000 by L.L. No. 3-2000]

There shall be a rear yard, the depth of which, except
as otherwise provided in this section, shall not be less than 25 feet.

There shall be two side yards, one on each side of
the main or accessory building, the aggregate width of which shall
be at least 60 feet. Neither side yard shall be less than 20 feet.
In the case of a corner lot, the side yard adjacent to the side street
shall have a depth of at least 60 feet.[Amended 7-11-2016 by L.L. No. 7-2016]

No building shall exceed 30 feet in height or 2 1/2
stories.

No building shall be erected on any lot having a street
frontage of less than 100 feet.
Accessory buildings and structures.

Accessory buildings and structures must be located
in a rear yard, and any such building or structure:

Must not be less than 20 feet from each side
lot line.

Must not exceed 12 feet in height at its highest
point when measured from the lowest point of the surrounding ground.

Must not be less than 10 feet from the rear
lot line.

Accessory buildings (but not accessory structures)
must not be nearer than 10 feet to the main building.

A private swimming pool shall be permitted in the rear yard of the premises, limited to the personal use of the family of the owner of the principal building or occupant thereof and its house servants and guests, said swimming pool not to be installed, maintained or used except in conformity with the provisions of Chapter 201, Swimming Pools.
